CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving.    It is an important city service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes.     The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride  the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of  the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt  that provides the smooth ride    What you observed was the patch in binder awaiting the final top course.     Any questions you call the City Engineer Tom Mougamian. 617-304-7308     The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work has caused.     Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride  the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt that provides the smooth ride.    What the constituent observed was the patch awaiting final top course.      The patch will be topped this week.    The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work has caused.    Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-06-12 08:25:51.043 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     National Grid is installing a new gas main.  The city encourages this type of capital upgrade work.  It will eliminate future emergency repairs.      National Grid has to install the gas main first.  Once the main has been installed  then all service connections can be made.      If the city were to make National Grid pave to grade each day's trench work   it would cause multiple seams along the trench.  More importantly  every service connection needs to be cut into the trench.  If we were to pave the trench every day   this would result in 2 by 2 patches inside the trench area  resulting in a very poor final product.  In order to have the best final paving  the city allows the utility company to leave the trench down low until all service connections are made and then pave the trench all at once  resulting in a smooth  level final trench repair.  Service laterals are topped within 24 hours of excavation.       What the constituent is observing is the trench left down low in preparation for one continuous final paving operation.    The trench is scheduled to be paved today.    Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

Closed date : 2015-07-17 09:15:22.513 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) investigated and determined the following:    The crosswalk in question did not meet ADA specifications.      On all sanctioned crosswalks a ramp is required on either side. Recommend that you contact BTD engineering regarding your request. CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-07-24 08:52:45.1 Case Resolved     Dear Constituent     The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working  in your neighborhood  performing patch paving.    It is an important city service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes.    The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride  the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt that provides the smooth ride.    What the constituent observed was the patch awaiting final top course.     The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work has caused.    Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-08-08 08:13:16.497 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:    National Grid is installing a new main on your street. The city highly encourages this type of work. It will eliminate possible future emergency leak repairs.     The city acknowledges that the construction will cause an inconvenience to the residents.    However in the long run the construction is well worth it.     Having a street dug up for emergency repairs soon after paving is frustrating for all. With the new gas main installed  the city can feel extremely comfortable that no embarrassing street cuts will happen if it determines to pave your street in the future    The inspector spoke to crew and told them they need to open up the street as much as possible during construction. They said they would comply with that request.     You can call the inspector Mark Lawson at 1-781-603-7674 .    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

Closed date : 2015-08-24 10:02:22.157 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:    The work is to repair a defective Comcast manhole cover.    The City in order to have these types of repaired as fast as possible issues neighborhood permits to the utility companies.    They are required to make sure that they start at 9:30 on arterial and 7am on residential streets.    The permit always leads with one street.    That's why you thought the permit was for a street blocks away.    The real problem was the contractor put down the dates of the neighborhood permit instead of the dates of work.    We did call the contractor today to make sure that he changes the dates for the days of the actual work itself.    We apologize for the inconvenience.    For any questions or concerns  please contact the the inspector assigned to Charlestown Joe Bocchetti at 781-603-7925    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-08-24 09:35:17.877 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     National Grid is installing a new gas main.  The city encourages this type of capital upgrade work.  It will eliminate future emergency repairs.      National Grid has to install the gas main first.  Once the main has been installed  then all service connections can be made.      If the city were to make National Grid pave to grade each day's trench work   it would cause multiple seams along the trench.  More importantly  every service connection needs to be cut into the trench.  If we were to pave the trench every day   this would result in 2 by 2 patches inside the trench area  resulting in a very poor final product.    In order to have the best final paving  the city allows the utility company to leave the trench down low until all service connections are made and then pave the trench all at once  resulting in a smooth  level final trench repair.  Service laterals are topped within 24 hours of excavation.       What the constituent is observing is the trench left down low in preparation for one continuous final paving operation.    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-08-24 09:46:12.423 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:    The property at 38 South Russell is being renovated.    Part of the scope of work is to install new water sewer and sewer drain.    The City acknowledges this is extensive and deep excavation work.    It takes time to make the connections.    That is why the location is plated nightly.    We sited the contractor for having banging plates last week.  We suspended his job for a day and brought him in to review the rules and regulations.    As of Saturday the CIU Inspector states there were no banging plates.    He also stated he could find no manhole cover banging as well.    The work is expected to be done by approx September 1st.    If you have any questions you can call the inspector Yan Wang-Jiang at 781-603-9921.    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-08-26 10:27:33.5 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     Eversource  Gas is installing a new gas main.  The city encourages this type of capital upgrade work.  It will eliminate future emergency repairs.      Eversource Gas has to install the gas main first.  Once the main has been installed  then all service connections can be made.      If the city were to make Eversource Gas pave to grade each day's trench work   it would cause multiple seams along the trench.    More importantly  every service connection needs to be cut into the trench.  If we were to pave the trench every day   this would result in 2 by 2 patches inside the trench area  resulting in a very poor final product.      In order to have the best final paving  the city allows the utility company to leave the trench down low until all service connections are made and then pave the trench all at once  resulting in a smooth  level final trench repair.      Service laterals are topped within 24 hours of excavation.       What the constituent is observing is the trench left down low in preparation for one continuous final paving operation.    For any questions or concerns  please contact the number listed below    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office        Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-08-28 10:19:03.86 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving.    It is an important city service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes.     The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride  the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of  the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt  that provides the smooth ride.     The street is leafleted before the work begins where it explains that it is a mufti phase construction operation and you should look at the dates since they will change as each construction phases progresses.     Our goal is to allow parking between phases and not post the street for the entire time the work takes place. This is why the contractor repeatedly changes the dates.     We spoke to the contractor about his need to be totally accurate when posting and leafleting  for upcoming work.    Since this is a patching contract  the contractor may only be on your street for only a short period of time; giving the appearance of not showing up.     Sometimes  poor weather  plant breakdowns  or equipment failure occurs which results in the delay of the upcoming work.    The CIU spoke to the contractor about his need to do a better job on changing the dates when those situations arise.     Any questions you call the City Engineer Tom Mougamian. 617-304-7308     The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work has caused.     Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-09-12 08:22:51.72 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     National Grid is installing a new main on your street. The city highly encourages this type of work. It will eliminate possible future emergency leak repairs.     The city acknowledges that the construction will cause an inconvenience to the residents.    However in the long run the construction is well worth it.     Having a street dug up for emergency repairs soon after paving is frustrating for all. With the new gas main installed  the city can feel extremely comfortable that no embarrassing street cuts will happen if it determines to pave your street in the future.     The CIU inspector states that the work will be done sometime this Fall    The inspector will monitor the work site to ensure full compliance with the city's rules.     The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work has caused.      Sincerely      Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department
Location: INTERSECTION of Olney St & Rock Ter  Dorchester  MA

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-09-25 10:08:57.07 Case Noted This work is at the intersection of Saratoga St  Barnes Ave and the MBTA Orient Heights Busway  and is part of the Neighborhood Safety Improvements Project - CIP 15-22.  The proposed improvement plan consists of constructing a neck-down on the NW corner with new pedestrian ramps and installation of a Rectangular Rapid Flash Beacon (RRFB).  The plan is aimed at improving pedestrian safety at this intersection by improving sight lines reducing conflict points  reducing the crossing distance and providing a flashing beacon warning motorists that a pedestrian is in the crosswalk.  There is also a benefit to bicyclists as motorists will have to transition through the intersection and yield to bicycles in the bike lane in order to access the exclusive right turn lane.  These plans are consistent with the Boston Complete Streets and Vision Zero initiatives.    The concept plan was developed during the East Boston Action Plan completed in 2008 and there were several meetings held at the time.  At these meetings  residents in the neighborhood expressed concern about the safety of pedestrians crossing Saratoga St at this intersection.  The plans were presented at a Neighborhood Council meeting held on May 18  2015 at the Orient Heights Yacht Club and  there were over 100 people in attendance a representative from PWD Engineering Division also attend the meeting.  The Council and the Boston Police Department were very much in favor of this plan to improve safety at this intersection.
SUBJECT: Public Works Department
QUEUE: BTDT_Engineering_Request for Traffic Signal Study or Review
Location: INTERSECTION of Bennington St & Saratoga St  East Boston  MA

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-10-05 08:39:52.867 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving.    It is an important city service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes.    The utility work previously done on your street was left with a temporary patch.    The City of Boston does not want the permanent asphalt cross section (typically 6.5" on residential street and 7.5"on main arterials) to be put back after the gravel down to the pipe has been disturbed.    There is a possibility that settlement could occur. Thats why the City waits before performing the cross section repair.  Our permanent patches hardly ever settle and that is the goal that any City or Town would want to happen regarding utility excavation work.    We do have a unit that inspects backfilling and temporary patches (The Construction Inspection Unit CIU) The CIU does stay on top of the contractors and utility companies.  Many of the temporary patches are in good condition.    However  the key is the patch is only 3".  We need the full cross section put back.    This is what you are seeing being done on your street right now.    Below is the steps taken to do the permanent repair.    The construction process is to dig out 6.5 to 7.5" inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride  the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt that provides the smooth ride.    I hope this explanation clarifies things for you.    If not please don't hesitate to call me.    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office  617-438-8517 Cell
SUBJECT: Public Works Department
Location: INTERSECTION of Arlington Ave & Beacham St  Charlestown  MA

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-10-31 14:48:44.107 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     The Boston Public Works  Department is currently reconstructing Staniford and Causeway Streets.    In addition we are allowing some utility work to be done before the final paving is scheduled.     When completed it will be a major improvement for  the pedestrians  cyclists and motorists who travel these street daily.    We acknowledge the construction is a major inconvenience to the public.     We have police details called in every day. They obviously will help with traffic control and public safety.    You will also notice more jersey barriers and barricades in use to help guide pedestrians and traffic through and around the work zones.    We have asked the contractor to restore all pavement markings within their work zone even if they have not disturbed the markings. This means that all crosswalks/ double yellows/skip lines/ arrow onlys etc will be maintained throughout the project.    All temporary pavement markings will be completed by November 6th    We ask for your patience while this major project takes place.    For any questions or concerns  please contact the project engineer Kay Barned-Smith at 617-635-4951    Sincerely      Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-10-20 08:36:52.097 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     Eversource Electric is installing a new transmission line on your street.    This will improve the reliability of electrical service in South Boston.    The contractor is McCourt.    The transmission line work requires more plates than usual do to the complications of this type of work.      We told the contractor McCourt though we acknowledge securing a large amount of plates is not easy it has to be done.    They need to berm the plates properly every time they leave the job  this will require them to wedge the plates  pin them  and tac weld problem plates when necessary.    The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) regularly inspects the work and has found for the most part they are in compliance with our rules and regs    We met with them recently and reviewed our procedures especially regarding plates  and we feel that you will have less complaints about loud noise.    The City acknowledges this is a major project and is an inconvenience to the residents of the street and we appreciate your patience and cooperation.    For any questions or concerns  please contact the number listed below    Sincerely     Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department
Location: 631 E Second St  South Boston  MA  02127

CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-11-14 08:41:20.3 Case Resolved   Dear Constituent        Eversource Electric  is installing new conduit.  The city encourages this type of capital upgrade work.  It will eliminate future emergency repairs.      Eversource Electric has to install the electric main first.  Once the main has been installed  then all service connections can be made.      If the city were to make Eversource Electric pave to grade each day's trench work   it would cause multiple seams along the trench.  More importantly  every service connection needs to be cut into the trench.  If we were to pave the trench every day   this would result in 2 by 2 patches inside the trench area  resulting in a very poor final product.      In order to have the best final paving  the city allows the utility company to leave the trench down low until all service connections are made and then pave the trench all at once  resulting in a smooth  level final trench repair.  Service laterals are topped within 24 hours of excavation.       What the constituent is observing is the trench left down low in preparation for one continuous final paving operation.    The trench was paved yesterday.    Thank you for your patience.    Mark Cardarelli  Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance  Boston Public Works Department  617-635-4951 Office
SUBJECT: Public Works Department
